revisions.rev:
{{Infobox Software | name = Netscape Navigator 9.0 | logo = [[Image:Netscape9logo.png|64px]] | screenshot = [[Image:Netscape9.png|250px]] | caption = Netscape Navigator 9.0.0.6 on Windows Vista displaying the main page of the English Wikipedia | author = | developer = [[Netscape|Netscape Communications]]
[[AOL]] | released = | frequently_updated = yes | programming language = [[C++]] | operating system = [[Cross-platform]] | platform = | language = | status = Discontinued as of March 1, 2008 | genre = [[Web browser]] | license = [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] | website = [http://archive.netscape.com/ archive.netscape.com] }} '''Netscape Navigator 9''' is a [[web browser]] produced by the [[Netscape|Netscape Communications]] division of parent [[AOL]], first announced on January 23, 2007. After AOL outsourced the development of [[Netscape Browser|Netscape Browser 8]] to [[Mercurial Communications]] in 2004, Netscape Navigator 9 marked the first Netscape browser to be produced in-house since [[Netscape 7]].[http://www.mozillazine.org/talkback.html?article=20397 Netscape announces cross-platform Netscape 9 to be developed in-house - Mozillazine] Retrieved on February 5, 2007 It also saw the return of the classic ''[[Netscape Navigator|Navigator]]'' name, which was previously used between Netscape versions 1.0 and 4.08.[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=8124 Netscape 9 - 1 May 2007 announcement] Retrieved on [[2 May|05-02]]-2007 The program's first [[Software release life cycle#Beta|beta]] was released on June 5, 2007,[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=8525 Netscape 9.0b1 released] Retrieved on [[5 June|06-05]]-2007 with the Beta 2 on July 12,[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=9067 Netscape Navigator 9.0b2 releases] Retrieved on [[13 July|07-13]]-2007 and Beta 3 on August 16.[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=9441 Netscape Community - messages #9441.1] Retrieved on [[16 August|08-16]]-2007 After a [[release candidate]], the final release was issued on October 15, 2007. On December 28, 2007, Netscape developers announced that AOL would discontinue their web browser on February 1, 2008.{{cite web |url= http://blog.netscape.com/2007/12/28/end-of-support-for-netscape-web-browsers/ |title= The Netscape Blog |accessdate=2007-12-28 |format= |work= Netscape, AOL}}. On January 28, 2008, Netscape revised this date to March 1, 2008, and offered support for migration to [[Flock (web browser)|Flock]] and [[Mozilla Firefox]].{{cite web |url= http://blog.netscape.com/2008/01/28/netscape-browser-support-extended-to-march-1st/ |title= The Netscape Blog |accessdate=2008-01-28 |format= |work=Netscape, AOL}} ==Features== ===New features=== The Beta releases of Netscape Navigator 9 includes enhanced [[newsfeed]] support and was more integrated with the [[Netscape#Propeller|Netscape.com]] Internet portal,[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=6418 Netscape 9 - 23 January 2007 announcement] Retrieved on January 24, 2007 including enhanced methods of discussion, submission and voting of web pages.[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=6926 Netscape 9 - 20 February 2007 Announcement] Retrieved on February 20, 2007 However as of Netscape Navigator 9 beta 3, the Netscape.com integration is now optional, and certain aspects of integration can be manually enabled or disabled,[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=9441 Netscape Navigator 9.0b3 released] Retrieved on [[17 August|08-17]]-2007 with integration being totally removed in Navigator 9.0rc1 as the portal relaunched as [[Propeller.com|Propeller]].[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&nav=messages&tid=9840&tsn= Netscape Community - Navigator 9.0rc3] Retrieved on [[2 October|10-02]]-2007. The [[user interface]] of the program has also been updated, and the theme was also later released for use on Mozilla Firefox.[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=7800 Netscape 9 - 10 February 2007 announcement] Retrieved on [[11 February|02-11]]-2007 Like Netscape version 8.x, Navigator 9 is based upon the [[Mozilla Firefox]], this time version 2.0, and should have full support of all Firefox [[add-ons]] and [[plugins]], some of which Netscape is providing.[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=6558 Netscape 9 - 6 February 2007 announcement] Retrieved on February 6, 2007 Netscape has also been releasing some of its features as extensions for Firefox, including the [http://blog.netscape.com/2006/12/06/browser-extensions/ Site Mail Notifier and Friends' Activity Sidebar], the [http://blog.netscape.com/2006/12/08/the-netscape-digg-tracker/ Digg Tracker], as well as [http://blog.netscape.com/2007/04/10/netstripe-netscape-9s-theme-for-firefox/ Netstripe], the new default theme for Netscape 9. The browser also includes [[Uniform Resource Locator|URL]] self-correction, which corrects common URL misspellings,[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=6677 Netscape 9 - 13 February 2007 announcement] Retrieved on June 6, 2007{{cite web |url= http://browser.netscape.com/whatsnew/9/ |title= What's New in Netscape Navigator? :: Netscape Navigator Web Browser |accessdate=2007-12-26 |format= |work=Netscape Communications, AOL |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20071103134727/http://browser.netscape.com/whatsnew/9/ |archivedate = 2007-11-03}} an improved [[FTP]] listing interface[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=6459 Netscape 9 - 30 January 2007 announcement] Retrieved on June 6, 2007 and a dedicated ''News'' menu with integration to the Netscape.com news portal.[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=7187 Netscape 9 - 6 March 2007 announcement] Retrieved on June 6, 2007 A quick "link pad" has also been included so web pages can quickly be added to the pad for later viewing without adding to the bookmark lists.[http://browser.netscape.com/features Netscape Navigator features] Retrieved on June 6, 2007 Navigator 9 also sees the browser return to multi-platform support across [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[Linux]] and [[Mac OS X]].[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=6459 Netscape 9 - 30 Jan 20m07 announcement] Retrieved on January 30, 2007 Netscape's signature splash screen also reappeared in the release candidate of the final program. ===Other features=== Unlike Netscape 8, the browser does not use [[Internet Explorer 6]]'s [[Trident (layout engine)|Trident layout engine]] as an alternative engine option, alongside various other additional features. Netscape Navigator did not include an [[email]] and [[newsgroups]] [[email client|client]] or an [[instant messaging]] client as Netscape 6 and 7 did. Netscape did, however, plan to produce a companion email client to complement the Navigator, confirmed as [[Netscape Messenger 9]].[http://browser.netscape.com/faq Netscape Navigator FAQ] Retrieved on June 6, 2007[http://community.netscape.com/n/pfx/forum.aspx?tsn=1&nav=messages&webtag=ws-nscpbrowser&tid=8692 Netscape Mercury/Messenger 9 requests at Netscape Community Support] Retrieved on June 12, 2007 While that software was in production, Netscape advised its users to use the [[Netscape 7]] series of [[Internet suite|suites]], which includes an email client, alongside Navigator 9 for browsing purposes. [[Image:Netscape9 bookofmozilla.png|thumb|250px|Screenshot of ''The Book of Mozilla'', 8:20 in Netscape 9]] A new verse 8:20 of the [[Easter egg (virtual)|Easter egg]] ''[[The Book of Mozilla#The Book of Mozilla, 8:20|The Book of Mozilla]]'' was written for the release of Netscape 9, consisting of ''"And thus the Creator looked upon the beast reborn and saw that it was good"''. This could have reference either to the re-development of Netscape in-house once again, or the [[Mozilla Foundation]] and its contributors.about:mozilla typed in the address bar of Netscape 9 Beta ==Response== [[Download.com|CNET Download.com]] claims Navigator 9 has some "neat" components, contains many "tricks we love" and is "more than a backup browser"; which they previously used to describe Browser 8. Most of the bundled features from version 8 have been removed.[http://www.download.com/Netscape-Navigator/3000-2356_4-10695623.html?tag=lst-0-5 Download.com review of Netscape Navigator 9] Retrieved on June 9, 2007 ==System requirements== '''Windows''' * 233 MHz processor (500 MHz recommended) * 64 MB of RAM (256 MB recommended) * 50 MB of free disk space (100 MB recommended) * Microsoft [[Windows 98]] ([[Windows XP]] recommended) '''Macintosh''' * PowerPC G3 processor (PowerPC G4 or Intel recommended) * 128 MB of RAM (512 MB recommended) * 75 MB of free disk space (150 MB recommended) * Mac OS X 10.2.x '''Linux''' * 233 MHz processor (500 MHz recommended) * 64 MB of RAM (256 MB recommended) * 50 MB of free disk space (100 MB recommended) * Linux kernel 2.2.14 (with glibc 2.3.2, XFree86-3.3.6, gtk+2.0, fontconfig/[[xft]] and libstdc++5){{cite web |url=http://browser.netscape.com/sysreqs/ |title= System Requirements :: Netscape Navigator Web Browser|accessdate=2007-11-29 |work= AOL |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20071021035445/http://browser.netscape.com/sysreqs/ |archivedate = 2007-10-21}} ==Release history== * Netscape Navigator 9.0b1 â June 5, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0b2 â July 12, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0b3 â August 16, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0rc1 â October 1, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0 â October 15, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0.0.1 â October 22, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0.0.2 â November 1, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0.0.3 â November 2, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0.0.4 â November 27, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0.0.5 â December 10, 2007 * Netscape Navigator 9.0.0.6 â February 20, 2008 ==See also== * [[List of feed aggregators]] * [[Comparison of feed aggregators]] ==References== {{reflist|2}} ==External links== * [http://archive.netscape.com/ The Netscape Archive] {{sequence| prev=[[Netscape Browser]] (8)| list= Netscape Navigator 9
